definition: to call oneself/to claim to be/to profess/to claim a title

sentences.english: The Chu general Zhuang Jiao entered the region from the upper Yangtze River and set himself up as "King of Dian".
sentences.chinese: 楚國的將軍莊郊從長江上游來到這裏自稱滇王。

sentences.english: The one sets the engine, is a grand-banquet's host named Oota-zyunya.
sentences.chinese: 設置引擎的，是一位自稱太田順也的盛宴之主。

sentences.english: Organovo calls itself a regenerative medicine company.
The University of Paderborn considers itself "The University for the Information Society".
sentences.chinese: 帕德波恩大學自稱爲一所“信息化社會大學”。

sentences.english: Giacomo reclaims his daughter, and the King professes his love.
sentences.chinese: 賈科莫回收他的女兒，國王自稱他的愛。

sentences.english: The Bible itself doesn't claim to have been written by God.
sentences.chinese: 聖經並未自稱是上帝之作。

sentences.english: His fans even began calling themselves Vayniacs.
sentences.chinese: 他的擁躉甚至開始以“沃伊腦殘粉”自稱。

sentences.english: He later apologized for what he said was an “inappropriate” remark.
sentences.chinese: 之後他爲這一自稱爲不恰當的評論做出了道歉。

sentences.english: They are professional quotes-deleted corporations and individuals, who call themselves " Online PR".
sentences.chinese: 他們是專業的刪帖公司和個人，自稱“網絡公關”。

sentences.english: Women's claim in nanchang city of jiangxi province, but mobile phone number is jiangxi shangrao.
sentences.chinese: 女子自稱江西南昌人，但手機號碼是江西上饒的。

sentences.english: He even identified himself, because he started claiming divine status for himself.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至標榜自己，自稱爲神。

sentences.english: How much do I have to change in order TO CLAIM copyright in someone else's work?
sentences.chinese: 這句是說改了圖後便自稱擁有修改後的版權。

sentences.english: He listed himself as a conservative.
sentences.chinese: 他自稱是一個保守主義者。

sentences.english: Anybody who set himself up as king, without being appointed king by the Senate, that was itself an act of treason.
sentences.chinese: 任何人自稱爲王，而不受元老院冊封，那就是叛國罪。

sentences.english: The beautiful women from antiquity she impersonates always call themselves "Nu Jia".
sentences.chinese: 她扮演的古代佳人總是自稱“奴家”。

sentences.english: Mao Zedong's Red Guards sometimes called themselves “new Boxers”.
sentences.chinese: 紅衛兵有時自稱“新義和團”。

definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
